msg: bien hecho, en este punto estamos seguros de que tu prueba será todo un éxito.

data.name: Mercury
data.description: Mercury is the smallest planet in the solar system and the closest to the Sun. Its surface is covered in craters, similar to the Moon, due to its thin exosphere. Despite its proximity to the Sun, Mercury is not the hottest planet—Venus holds that title. Daytime temperatures reach 430°C, while at night, they drop to -180°C.

data.name: Venus
data.description: Venus is the second planet from the Sun and the hottest in the solar system. Its thick atmosphere is primarily composed of carbon dioxide, and its surface is dotted with volcanoes. A day on Venus is longer than its year, and it rotates in the opposite direction to most planets.

data.name: Earth
data.description: Earth is the only planet known to support life. It has vast oceans and a protective atmosphere that shields it from solar radiation. Earth is the third planet from the Sun and has one natural satellite: the Moon.

data.name: Mars
data.description: Mars, known as the Red Planet, is the fourth planet from the Sun. It has the largest volcano and canyon in the solar system, and scientists believe that Mars may have once supported liquid water. Today, it is a cold, dry desert.

data.name: Jupiter
data.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in the solar system, with a mass greater than all other planets combined. It is known for its Great Red Spot, a giant storm that has been raging for over 300 years. Jupiter has dozens of moons, including Ganymede, the largest moon in the solar system.

data.name: Saturn
data.description: Saturn is best known for its spectacular ring system, made of ice and rock. It is the second-largest planet in the solar system and has a large number of moons, including Titan, which has a dense atmosphere and is larger than the planet Mercury.

data.name: Uranus
data.description: Uranus is unique among the planets for rotating on its side. It is a giant icy planet with a faint ring system and 27 moons. Its atmosphere contains methane, which gives the planet its blue-green color.

data.name: Neptune
data.description: Neptune is the farthest planet from the Sun and is known for its deep blue color, caused by methane in its atmosphere. It is a giant icy planet with strong winds, the fastest recorded in the solar system. Neptune has 14 moons, the largest of which is Triton.
